meanings.definition: To send or guide in the wrong direction
meanings.sent1: The tricky map misdirected us to the forest instead of the beach.
meanings.sent2: He intentionally misdirected the lost hikers towards the closed trail.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel misdirected the bird to the bird feeder filled with nuts.
meanings.sent4: Her false directions misdirected him like a compass pointing south instead of north.
meanings.sent5: The faulty GPS misdirected the delivery truck into a dead-end alley.

meanings.definition: To give false or misleading information
meanings.sent1: The scammer tried to misdirect the elderly couple into giving away their personal information.
meanings.sent2: The spy's mission was to misdirect the enemy agents with fabricated intel.
meanings.sent3: The magician's misdirection made the audience believe the coin vanished into thin air.
meanings.sent4: Her clever misdirection in the debate made her opponent stumble over his words.
meanings.sent5: The misleading sign misdirected the tourists to the closed exhibit.

meanings.definition: To divert or distract from the correct course or purpose
meanings.sent1: The loud noise outside misdirected my attention from studying for the test.
meanings.sent2: The sudden interruption misdirected the team's focus during the crucial meeting.
meanings.sent3: The tempting smell of fresh cookies misdirected me from my diet plan.
meanings.sent4: Her unexpected question misdirected the conversation to a completely different topic.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights misdirected the driver, causing him to miss the turn.
